page.title: 08Information Systems.
page.content: The{library}in Manor Road was originally used as a Congregational Chapel and County School. It is open on 5 days each week. Â£2760 per year are spent on books for Verwood, and there are approximately 11,000 books in stock. You may borrow 4 books at a time for up to 3 weeks. 3923 people belong to the library, this includes 800 children. There is a{reference {section}and leaflets on many aspects on village and area life are available.{Village diaries}are kept at the library and the Leisure Centre. The{Blue Van}sponsored by the County Council attends the car park once a week and enables people who are unable to visit the council offices to obtain advice and information.
